alert.note: Alert for Tioga (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 10:28AM EST until December 19 at 2:30PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New York...Pennsylvania... Susquehanna River At Binghamton Washington Street affecting Broome County. Susquehanna River At Waverly/Sayre affecting Bradford and Tioga Counties. Susquehanna River At Bainbridge affecting Chenango and Delaware Counties. Susquehanna River At Unadilla affecting Otsego and Delaware Counties. Susquehanna River Near Windsor affecting Broome County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New York...Pennsylvania... Susquehanna River At Owego affecting Tioga County. Susquehanna River At Towanda affecting Bradford County. Susquehanna River Near Wilkes-Barre affecting Luzerne County. Susquehanna River At Meshoppen affecting Wyoming County. Susquehanna River At Vestal affecting Broome and Tioga Counties. Susquehanna River At Conklin affecting Susquehanna and Broome Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Susquehanna River at Owego. * WHEN...From this evening to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, Flood stage. Backyards of homes and businesses right along the northern edge of the river begin to flood. Hickories Park floods. Flood waters back up along Owego Creek into the Fairgrounds and portions of Route 96. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EST Monday the stage was 23.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 23.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 30.3 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 30.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1030 PM EST.
